channel.title: Runefest
channel.description:
So, Jagex announced runefest, which is basicly a runescape convention where half the people there are gonna be epic nerds or the other half are there to laugh at those nerds. [url=http://www.runefest.com]www.runefest.com[/url]
[b]What is RuneFest?[/b] RuneFest celebrates RuneScape, the world's largest free MMO, and the amazing community that has grown up with it. It will take place on Saturday 28th August, and will be packed with activities and events for RuneScape enthusiasts. [b] Where will RuneFest be held?[/b] RuneFest will take place in London, UK, at a location we will announce shortly. [b]How do I register for a priority ticket?[/b] Click here to register for a priority ticket and to receive email updates about RuneFest 2010. [b]How and when can I purchase tickets?[/b] Enter your email address here, and we’ll let you know as soon as you can buy tickets for RuneFest. [b]How much do the tickets cost?[/b] Price details and associated deals will be announced on RuneFest.com soon; registering for email updates means you'll be among the first to know. [b]What events are planned for RuneFest?[/b] We'll be announcing our plans in the coming days, but in the meantime, read the Live Events page to see some examples of the sorts of exciting activities that will be available. [b] Is RuneFest suitable for children? [/b] No. Alcohol will be available at this event, for which proof of age will be required. Because of this, the event will only be suitable for our adult fans.
Alcohol? Fuck I live in America, but that still kills how many people are going to be there. Dicuss.
